reviews.text: I had booked this hotel after reading some generally positive reviews on TripAdvisor. It must be said though that the city of Trento does not offer that many hotels to begin with. It is primarily an important University town and is often overlooked by tourists, hence the infrastructure for visitors is not as well developed as say, Milan, Venice, Florence or even Verona. Despite that, we decided to stay for 2 nights in Trento as it provides an ideal base to explore the Trentino region of Italy and the Italian Alps.

reviews.text: Firstly, the reception staff. Awful manners and no follow up at all. Just as an example - I asked for an umbrella as it was raining. The reception staff assured me that she would keep one for me when I was about to go out of the hotel. when I came down, she said she had forgotten about it and lent the umbrella to someone else!
reviews.title: it's grand

reviews.text: Another more horrendous episode was when I asked for dinner reservations to be made. The staff at the reception reassured me that it would be done. When we turned up at the restaurant, we discovered to our horror that it was closed!!! I complained to the reception staff on duty the same evening and she did not seem all that bothered. So much for service at this hotel.

While these may have been appropriate for days gone by, it seems all too big for the room size. Cleanliness was also an issue. My room balcony had cigarette butts all over the floor (and it was a non-smoking floor!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This wa sthe last Italian stop on our trip before heading back to Munich. We chose Trento as it was perfectly in the middle between Pisa and Munich so broke up our journey nicely. The only thing I wish we'd done now is booked longer as Trento is such a lovely little town! I will definitely be coming back! The hotel was what I call a proper hotel - we had been staying at small B&B's throughout our trip whereas this was a big hotel, and quite fancy! I didn't expect it to look like it did, despite seeing pictures. It had quite a luxurious feel to it. The room was a pretty good size and of a really high standard. The bathroom was also very nice and modern, and quite big. Everything was spotlessly clean and tidy. The location was great, about a 5 min walk from the centre so really useful. I can't get over how nice the hotel was yet we only paid £60 for the room! I would definitely recommend this place, and will be coming back on our next trip!
reviews.title: Great hotel in excellent location!

reviews.text: Nice hotel, the decor is a bnit dated and the fabric covered walls and heavy velvet curtains made the room feel small and dark. In this day and age no in room wi-fi is a big minus in four star hotel. The other facilities such as the bar and restaurant are good. Fantastic little city and the hotel is ideally located for the train stattion and city centre.
reviews.title: decent hotel, top end price, beautiful city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Trento in late April. The hotel is beautiful inside and the staff at reception are extremely helpful and cordial. We got maps and restaurant suggestions from the perfect English speaking reception personnel as well as a discount coupon for touring the Castello (an old castle in town). The castle is very much worth a visit. Our room was very comfortable and the bathroom had a magnifying mirror which I appreciated. There was a bidet, hairdryer, toiletries and thick fluffy towels and bathrobes. There is a big park across the street and it is walking distance from grocery stores and eateries. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel and Wonderful People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to the Grand Hotel. We remembered it fondly from a stay two years ago, and it is even nicer now, with brand-new carpeting and doors that close so softly we had to double check to make sure they'd actually latched. When we arrived, we were welcomed as returning guests, and mail we'd had sent there was already waiting in our room.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel in a terrific location. Quiet, comfortable and gracious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent too--across a small park from the train station, and only a few steps from the historical district. The hotel is modern and well-designed. We can't imagine staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great as usual

reviews.text: I liked the hotel, expecially the rooms, because they are big and elegant, with really nice forniture. Beds were confortable, and everything was extremely clean. The isolation against the noise is really good, which I consider important and quite rare. The position is convenient, close to the centre, but the hotel is not inside the historical centre, so you don't have a nice view.
